data.title: Willem B. Drees
data.text:
Willem B. Drees is Professor emeritus of Philosophy of the Humanities and a former dean of the Tilburg School of Humanities. He currently serves as the academic secretary of the humanities and social sciences of the Royal Holland Society of the Sciences and Humanities (KHMW). He is especially interested in the nature and task of the humanities in the contemporary university and in society. Before coming to Tilburg University, he held at Leiden University the chair in Philosophy of Religion and Ethics and was the editor of Zygon: Journal of Religion and Science (2008-2018).

Inaugural address in Tilburg, January 30 2015:

Naked Ape or techno-sapiens? The Relevance of Human Humanities (Tilburg University; online http://www.drees.nl/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/150008_oratie_prof_Drees_web.pdf )
